dialogue: Berniece say you all going down to the bank.
Yeah, they give me a half day off work. I got an appointment to talk to the bank about getting a loan to start my church.
Tell him what you told me. Tell him about the three hobos.
Boy Willie don’t want to hear all that.
Go on. I told him you was a preacher. He didn’t want to believe me. Tell him about the three hobos.
Well, it come to me in a dream. See...I was sitting out in this railroad yard watching the trains go by. The train stopped and these three hobos got off.
They told me they had come from Nazareth. And was on their way to Jerusalem.
They had three candles. They gave me one and told me to light it... But to be careful that it didn’t go out.
Next thing I knew I was standing in front of this house. Something told me to go knock on the door.
This old woman opened the door and said they had been waiting on me. Then she led me to this room.

It was a big room and it was full of all kinds of different people. They looked like anybody else... Through the hole he sees a congregation, dressed in their Sunday best, but he can only see from their waist down.
...except they all had sheep heads and was all making noise like sheep make. A large sheep’s eye meets him on the other side of the wall. He now sees that all the bodies have sheep heads.
I heard somebody call my name.
Oh, they talked to me real nice. I told Berniece...they say maybe they let me borrow the money. They done talked to my boss down at work and everything.
That’s what I told Berniece. You working every day you ought to be able to borrow some money.
I’m getting more people in my congregation every day. Berniece says she gonna be the Deaconess. I get me my church I can get married and settled down. That’s what I told Berniece.
That be nice. You ought to go ahead and get married. Berniece don’t need to be by herself. I tell her that all the time.
Well, let her find that out then. If Avery blessing the house is gonna make her feel better...what you got to do with it?
Berniece say Maretha seen him too. I don’t know, but I found a part in the Bible to bless the house. If he is here then that ought to make him go.
